page.title: 05FLYING
page.content: {Blackbushe Airfield}was built in World War Two, as a light bomber aerodrome. Today it is privately owned by British Car Auctions. A collection of old aircraft is being disbanded at the moment,and two other areas are set aside; one for a Sunday Market, the other for a private flying club. This provides trial lessons for pleasure, and aerobatic flights. The price of the lessons varies from Â£20- Â£60. The club's main aim is to train people for their private pilot's licence ,but it is also a membership club, with about 400 members. Most of the planes flown are Cessnas,but there are several helicopters. The club has some military connections running courses for the Military Academy at Sandhurst.
